conclusion: Analyze the process of an ideal gas undergoing a cycle ABCDA.
The cycle ABCDA involves changes in volume and pressure, starting from state D at higher pressure P2 and volume V2.
According to the first law of thermodynamics, work done by the gas is equal to the change in internal energy.
Calculate the change in internal energy using temperature at state A, given by ΔU = m · ΔT.
Determine the work done by the gas, W = ΔU = m · ΔT = m · (T0 - TA).
Substitute known values: ΔT = T0 - TA = P1 · V1 - TA.
Calculate work done: W = m · (P1 · V1 - TA).
Assume mass m is constant for simplicity, thus work done is W = m · (P1 · V1 - TA).
Assume values for P1 · V1 and TA are given, thus work done is W = m · (P1 · V1 - TA).
